This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to expand bai monitoring and conservation research operations at Langoué Bai in Ivindo National Park in order to support ecotourism development, inform management planning, and ensure protection of elephant populations visiting the bai. The project will: 1) Implement a targeted bai monitoring program designed to assess the status of the elephant population. Bai monitoring activities include: reviewing existing monitoring protocols and developing a long-term strategy for monitoring all large mammals in the bai; ensuring that data is collected on a daily basis at the bai; conducting regular reconnaissance walks in the forest zone immediately surrounding the bai; and facilitating short and long-term research projects for researchers. 2) Ensure necessary infrastructure and equipment is in place to facilitate access of research teams to the clearing. Access activities include: maintaining access road to Langoué field camp; and ensuring maintenance and improvements of field station buildings to accommodate additional personnel, researchers and visitors. 3) Ensure that ecotourism products and activities are well-planned across the Southern Ivindo landscape. Ecotourism activities include: consulting with ANPN and Aman Resorts representatives to outline a plan for appropriate ecotourism development products; mapping existing knowledge useful for ecotourism activities; and conducting field prospection missions to at least three sites..

description.narrative: Gabon is an active contributor to conflict resolution and regional security efforts in the Central African region, hosting, and acting as a driving force behind the Economic Community of Central African States, which is establishing a regional standby peacekeeping brigade under the auspices of the African Union's Africa Standby Force. U.S. security assistance to Gabon is aimed at professionalizing the small armed forces (fewer than 8,000 armed service members) by providing training, which will create a force able to operate effectively in regional peacekeeping and maritime security efforts. Gabon has roughly 500 troops participating in U.N peacekeeping efforts in the Central African Republic.
